result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution. Balance to be paid joint and several as a condition of probation. To be paid before any fees or costs.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint. Case 14CM742 was dismissed and read in. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain schooling - Obtain a HSED or GED and then employment. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation STRAIGHT TIME. Sentence credit of 24 days were granted. STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 155 Days were granted.
07/13/2018 COURT GRANTS ONE ADDITIONAL DAY OF SENTENCE CREDIT.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Balance of unpaid costs previously imposed to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Unpaid Balance of Restitution previously imposed to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. To be paid before costs or fees.

No Contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint. Comply with mental health/psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain a HSED or GED. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 04/15/16 sentencing hearing after revocation.

Defendant Anthony J Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Sonderhouse makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

2 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 155 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling-obtain HSED/GED 
____No contact with:  victims listed in criminal compalint
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  Previously ordered (balance remaining to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  Costs previously ordered (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony J Williams in court with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Sonderhouse makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Maintain schooling-obtain HSED/GED and then employment 
____No contact with: victim listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $8,595.98 (joint and several) (to be paid to victim as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 60 days (24 days credit) straight time - STAYED (to be used at agent's discretion)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence**
